Both outputs are technically sound with minor differences in approach and cost assumptions.

The semantic intent is highly aligned with both providing compute costs storage costs data volume analysis and manual effort estimates. Minor differences exist in cost calculation methodologies and specific pricing assumptions.

Both outputs follow nearly identical structural organization with three main sections. Both use numbered sections (1 2 3) and similar subsection hierarchies. Agent_1 uses more bullet-point formatting while Agent_2 uses more descriptive headers but the logical flow and decomposition approach are essentially the same.

Minor calculation inconsistency: Total data processed calculation shows 450 GB but individual components (225+30+75+120) sum to 450 GB correctly. Storage cost calculation uses correct formula. All syntax and mathematical operations are valid.

Highly accurate calculations and consistent data references. Minor formatting inconsistency in data volume presentation (mixing TB and GB units) but all conversions are mathematically correct. All technical specifications are properly formatted.

Both outputs demonstrate high technical accuracy with proper calculations consistent data references and valid cost estimation methodologies. Minor formatting and presentation differences do not impact correctness.
